item.title: How to emulate Persistent Memory
item.description: Data allocated with PMDK is put to the virtual memory address space, and concrete ranges are relying on result of mmap(2) operation performed on the user defined files. Such files can exist on any storage media, however data consistency assurance embedded within PMDK requires frequent synchronisation of data that is being modified. Depending on platform capabilities, and underlying device where the files are, a different set of commands is used to facilitate synchronisation.
